newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Gold closes firmer at day's high in Hong Kong.
newsitem.headline: Gold closes firmer at day's high in Hong Kong.

text.p: Hong Kong gold closed firmer at the day's high on Thursday, climbing from New York's close on late overseas buying, but dealers said trading was quiet and slow.
Bullion ended at US$342.40/90 an ounce, up from New York's US$341.00/50 close on Wednesday and Hong Kong's previous close of US$340.10/60.
"Overseas players bought gold in the afternoon session, but not too much," said a dealer at a local investment house. "The immediate gold trend is uncertain as the market lacks a clear direction."
Gold would range-trade between US$338 and $345 in the short term, traders said.
Local gold ended HK$15 higher at HK$3,167 a tael.
The carry over charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver Exchange Society dropped to -6.50 from -5.00.
